title: Anthony Joshua vs Andy Ruiz Jr rematch venue construction begins in Saudi Arabia
text:

Work has begun on the temporary stadium which will host Anthony Joshua's huge rematch with Andy Ruiz Jr in Saudi Arabia in December.

The heavyweight duo will do battle for a second time in a Gladiator-style, three-sided venue on a night dubbed then "Clash on the Dunes".

The Diriyah Arena is being constructed especially for the fight on the outskirts of Riyadh and is expected to feature a unique look, with a capacity of 15,000 fans.

Tickets for the December 7 clash went on sale this week, with Matchroom Boxing CEO Frank Smith sharing footage of construction of the arena getting underway on the UNESCO heritage site.

(Image: Matchroom/Twitter)

The foundations of temporary stands were seen one one side of what is set to be the ring, with a large shell of what looks to be the stage area housing changing rooms, VIPS and TV studios opposite.

Joshua was stunned by Ruiz Jr at Madison Square Garden in June and will be looking to recapture his IBO, WBA, IBF and WBO world titles from the Mexican-American.

(Image: Matchroom/Twitter)

(Image: Matchroom/Twitter)

But Ruiz fired a warning to Joshua this week - telling him he will arrive in better shape than ever as he looks to condemn the Brit to his second professional defeat.

"I will arrive in better condition.... lighter, faster and more powerful," Ruiz said to ESPN Deportes. "They will believe that in December they will win.

"People will always talk like this, but I have faith that we're going to win and shut up more mouths.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

"I have a lot of respect for Anthony, outside the ring he is a very good man. But inside [the ring] there are no friends, there is no respect or anything.

"It will not be an easy fight. I think it will be a hard fight, but nothing is easy in life, so we are training very hard. We will be prepared for whatever he brings."
description: Anthony Joshua vs Andy Ruiz Jr will take place in a purpose-built venue which is now being built in Saudi Arabia
